docs.snippet: The father of a New Jersey boy with autism says he's "humbled and grateful" for messages of support after his Facebook post lamenting his son's lack of friends went viral.

headline.print_headline: Dad's Post Leads to Outpouring of Support for Autistic Boy
headline.main: Dad's Post Leads to Outpouring of Support for Autistic Boy

docs.snippet: Twitter's stock is surging following a report that the social media company, forever struggling in Facebook's shadow, is close to a sale.

headline.print_headline: Twitter Surges After Report That It May Be on the Block
headline.main: Twitter Surges After Report That It May Be on the Block

docs.snippet: The Massachusetts senator recently attacked the hedge fund manager Whitney Tilson in a Facebook post, despite his support of her and new financial industry regulations.

headline.print_headline: Elizabeth Warren  Attacks the Wrong Man
headline.main: Elizabeth Warren Condemns the Wrong Man

docs.abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column puzzles over Sen Elizabeth Warren's Facebook attack on Whitney Tilson, lifelong Democrat and open critic of Donald J Trump; suggests she is wrong to lump Kase Capital hedge fund manager with rest of Wall Street culture.

docs.snippet: The Republican Party of Kentucky has asked a state House candidate to drop out of the race after he posted several photos on Facebook depicting President Barack Obama and the first lady as monkeys.

headline.print_headline: GOP Asks Ky. Candidate to Drop Out After Offensive Posts
headline.main: GOP Asks Ky. Candidate to Drop Out After Offensive Posts

docs.snippet: A group of middle school students was recorded chanting a racial slur on their school bus in an online video.

headline.print_headline: Video: Schoolchildren Recorded Chanting Racial Slur on Bus
headline.main: Video: Schoolchildren Recorded Chanting Racial Slur on Bus

docs.snippet: In the span of a week, students have faced widespread criticism after posting photos to social media.

headline.main: Firestorms at 2 Colleges After Students Share Racially Charged Photos

docs.snippet: A former interior minister says he will resign his seat in parliament next week to face a probe on charges of manslaughter in the case of a policeman who died while escorting the politician.

headline.print_headline: Romania: Ex-Minister to Quit as Senator to Allow Probe
headline.main: Romania: Ex-Minister to Quit as Senator to Allow Probe

docs.snippet: Vonn announced on her Facebook page that she had “severely fractured” the humerus bone of her right arm in a training crash on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Vonn Is Again Sidelined by an Injury
headline.main: Lindsey Vonn Fractures Arm, Putting Her World Cup Season in Question

docs.abstract: American downhill skiier and Olympic medalist Lindsay Vonn suffers broken arm while training, her fourth serious injury in five seasons.

docs.snippet: Adama Barrow, the victor, said he would try to convince President Yahya Jammeh that it was in Gambia’s “supreme interest” to transfer power smoothly.

headline.print_headline: Uncertainty in Gambia After President Rejects Defeat
headline.main: Gambians Face Uncertainty After President Rejects His Defeat

docs.snippet: Singapore signed an agreement on Wednesday to start testing self-driving buses, as the city-state pushes ahead with its vision of using autonomous technology to help deal with the challenges posed by its limited land and labor.

headline.print_headline: All Aboard! Singapore Now to Try Out Self-Driving Buses
headline.main: All Aboard! Singapore Now to Try Out Self-Driving Buses
